arrangement.p: This collection is organized in one series.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This item was found in the Ryder Collection of Confederate Archives in 2011; the Ryder collection was cataloged as part of the WPA in 1939/1940 but in later decades the catalog ( A Calendar of the Ryder Collection of the Confederate Archives at Tufts College 1940) was forgotten and library staff added other materials to the Ryder collection, usually items from the South, from the 18th and 19th century and around the time of the Civil War.
Because the item was not part of the original Ryder collection, it was removed and a separate, 'artificial' collection was created.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes one poster from 1856 offering a 300-dollar reward for a run-away slave from New Orleans, Louisiana.
